fast3d.math

Class MatrixCalculation

  • java.lang.Object
    • fast3d.math.MatrixCalculation

  • public abstract class MatrixCalculation
extends java.lang.Object
    Calculation Class for static usage
    a matrix is a 2dim- double-array with mostly/preferred a same length of first and second dimension
    a matrixes height is the length of the first dimension, it's width the second dimensions length
    the second dimensions length has to be the same for all of the first dimensions entries
    Author:
    Tim Trense

    • Field Detail

      • zeroLockControl

        @Deprecated
public static double zeroLockControl
        Deprecated. 
        a value to determine what a zero in a matrix should be turn into, to prevent zero-locks
        should be zero for lighting calculation
        default = 0.0d
        zeroLocks will probably not happen any more

                                        double rad)

      • mul

        public static double[] mul(double[][] m,
                           double[] vec)
        m is (y X x) - matrix. m.length==y , m[0].length==x
        multiplies the given vector-coordinates with the matrix as defined mathematical
        the matrixes dimensions length has to equal the length of the given vector-array
        Parameters:
        m - the matrix
        vec - the vector which will not be changed
        Returns:
        the multiplied vector

      • mul

        public static void mul(double[][] m,
                       Vector3d vec)
        a faster way for a vector-instance to be multiplied and not to generate an array of its coordinates
        the matrixes dimension length has to be 3
        Parameters:
        m - the matrix to multiply the vector with
        vec - the vector to be multiplied with the matrix

      • rref

        public static void rref(double[][] matrix)
        edits the parameter
        reduced row echelon form (rref)
        the result of a linear equation system can be determined directly if its matrix is in the rref
        at this point it is magic
        Parameters:
        matrix - the matrix of the LES

      • solveLinearEquationSystem

        public static double[] solveLinearEquationSystem(double[][] matrix)
        a linear equation system (LES) has the row-form aX+bY+...=C
        the LES has to have one row per variable to solve
        the coefficients of the variables are entries of the matrix; C is the last entry of each line and a constant
        Parameters:
        matrix - a two-dim. array with the first dimension as its height
        Returns:
        the result of the LES as x=[0], y=[1], ...
